intro: Humata hookeri, commonly known as the Hooker's humata, is a rare and unique plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in dense forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Humata hookeri is considered a vulnerable species.
